TopicTitle: Where the hell is the Tundra Biome?

Articles.Content:
I can't seem to find it, I looked up the Biome map on KSPWiki but I can't "SEE" it on the map.

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/w/images/5/51/KerbinBiomeMap.png
I am assuming it is right next to the poles. See the lighter colours?

I am assuming it is right next to the poles. See the lighter colours?

I can't see it, to me it's not any lighter then the others... >_<

Halp?
If you look closely, the area just south of the north ice cap matches the color of the tundra biome.
It is right next to the poles. There is an Island in the lower right corner of the map. It is half grassland and half Tundra (in the south of it)
Well, it's kinda their fault for giving Tundra a color near-identical to Grassland's.

Tundra was very hard to find for me. It's just a thin strip of biome around the edge of the polar biome. I finally got a confirmed landing I'm the south pole. Just barely past the large mountain range down there. I had to land and hop a few times back and forth between the maintains and the polar cap to actually get in it. Very annoying.

It's a very small biome near the north pole.

EDIT: Yay! 1,000 posts!

as all the other people say, next to the poles

go to around 01:00 and scott will show you the way

While it may or may not be a bug and/or mod effect of some kind, in my KSP tundra can be found in a lot of places. There's a hill to the west of KSC that has the Tundra biome present on it in my saves.
There's also a bit not far west from the KSC, but I doubt that's intentional...
There are many glitches for wrong biodomes in wrong places. But, yeah tundra is a thin strip along any grassland, highlands or mountains near the poles.
Yep. I have a tundra area on the equator for some reason as well.

I am assuming it is right next to the poles. See the lighter colours?

it's the ice sheet overlapping land next to the north pole, yes. So aim for the border region between white and green.

Well, look at this map:

The pink part it is probably the tundra.
